intro: [WRONG START] Astelea fragrans, commonly known as the fragrant aster, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to New Zealand. It features tall, upright stems that bear clusters of small, white to pale blue flowers. The plant produces a sweet, aromatic scent, particularly noticeable in the evening. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Astelia fragrans thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for gardens in temperate climates.
